text:
I still think an "IDE" channel is good, for having general discussion about different IDEs!:slightly_smiling_face:
For specific tooling in IDEs, I think this channels like these are better! Plus if someone has a new IDE to share, would be great for those too! I think all such guys will end up either on <#C9YGT3NG4|emacs> or <#CA8TYH0LU|vim> which will create the current situation again!

text:
can make one and advertise it I guess, but again, different IDEs don't have much in common in terms of trouble shooting etc.

Editor is like OS, people just don't switch that often and they are never a show stopper (unlike language, which is why people hop to Julia)

elements.text:

Editor is like OS, people just don't switch that often and they are never a show stopper (unlike language, which is why people hop to Julia)

text:
OS hopping is really more common in low-level language users....
I change editors almost every year. I was on Vim + Atom last year
This year its VSCode + Kakoune:slightly_smiling_face:

I see both as a direct upgrade to what I used before!
